column3:
我がもの顔で暴れてる奴らの隠れ家に
乗り込んで、一つ懲らしめてやってくださいよ
column4:
Please go to
to the hideouts of those who are raging against
themselves and punish them one by one!

column3:
ヤツら、金目の装身具をずいぶん
略奪してるみたいで、鉱泉の客足にも
響くってもんです
column4:
They seem to be looting a lot of gold-grained
trinkets
, which will affect the number of visitors to the
mineral springs

column3:
うーむ困ったことになったんですよ
覚者さん！
column4: Ummm, I'm in trouble, Arisen!

column3:
ボルド鉱山の頂きに、祠があるのはご存知で？
その祠――《山頂の小堂》付近が
グリフィンの巣になってましてね
column4:
Did you know that there is a shrine at the top of
the Boldt Mine?
That shrine - near the small hall at the top of
the mountain
is a Griffin's nest.

column3:
グリフィンがしばしばそこで羽休めをしてたん
ですが、特に厄介なグリフィンが
舞い戻ってきたんですよ！
column4:
Griffins often rested their wings there
, but one particularly nasty griffin came back
!

column3:
覚者さん、どうかそのグリフィンを
追い払っちゃくれませんかね？
また、詳しくは追って説明しますんで
column4:
Arisen, can you please get rid of that griffin?
I'll explain the details later.

column3:
当鉱泉はお客様の需要にあわせ
３つの浴場を用意してますよ
column4:
We have three bathhouses at
to meet your needs!

column3:
どうぞ、ごゆるりと
それぞれのお湯を楽しんでください！
入場キーは受付けのルーシーが販売しております
column4:
Please relax and
enjoy each hot tub!
Admission keys are available for sale by Lucy at
the reception!

column3:
私は一応この地域の顔役もやってましてね
組合宿のリビアンともども、自治と仕事の斡旋も
引き受けてるってわけです
column4:
I'm also the face of the community
and the union inn, Livian, and I also take care
of the local government and job placement

column3:
キノザとボルド鉱山のため、良かったら
一肌脱いで頂けませんかね、風呂だけに！
column4:
For the sake of Kinoza and Volden Mine, if you
would like to
please give us a skinful, just for the bath!

column3:
実は、ちょっと私は人外方面の方とも
付き合いがありましてね
column4:
Actually, I have a bit of a relationship with
the non-human side of things, too.

column3:
覚者さんだったら、ご存知じゃありませんか？
穴ぐらに住んでる連中と会ったら
よろしくお伝えください
column4:
If you are an Arisen person, wouldn't you know?
If you see any of the guys living in the cave,
please send them my regards at

column3:
おお、いらっしゃい！
キノザとボルドに関して
私に何かご用で？
column4:
Oh, welcome!
Regarding Kinoza and Volden:
What can I do for you?

column3:
おお、覚者さんにお伝えしたいことがあるんですよ！
《辺境の礎》ってやつがこのボルドでも
使えるようになりましてね
column4:
Oh, I have something to tell you, Arisen!
Subcrystals are now available at here in Volden!

column3:
何でも、行きづらかったところに
一瞬で到着する便利な代物だとか
column4:
I hear it's a convenient way to get to places
you've been trying to get to
in an instant.

column3:
キノザの管理者としては、ボルドにいらっしゃるなら
ぜひともこのキノザに寄って一風呂浴びていって
ほしいところですが――
column4:
As the manager of Kinoza, if you're in Volden,
I'd love for you to stop by Kinoza and take a
bath.

column3:
ま、任務の途中や帰りにも、疲れを癒すために
ぜひお湯に浸かっていってくださいよ！
いつでもお待ちしてますんで！
column4:
Well, please visit
to soak in the hot water to relieve your fatigue
on your way to or from your mission!
We're always waiting for you!

column3:
おお、覚者さんじゃないですか！
ちょうどよかった
一つ相談に乗っちゃくれませんか
column4:
Oh, you are an Arisen, aren't you?
I was just in time.
Can you help me with one thing?

column3:
いや、《ボルド大坑道》についてなんですけどね
せっかく再開発も軌道に乗り始めたところだってのに
最近妙な噂が立っちまって鉱員が集まらないんですよ
column4:
No, I'm talking about the Boldt Tunnel.
The redevelopment is just getting back on track.
Lately there have been strange rumors and it's
hard to get miners.

column3:
なんでも、骸骨騎士が坑内を歩いてる――とか
光るドクロがこっちを見てた――とか
気味が悪いでしょう
column4:
Anything, a skeletal knight walking down the mine
shaft-- or
a glowing skull looking at me-- or
It must be creepy!

column3:
多分何かの魔物がうろついてるんだと思うんですがね
覚者さん、そいつを退治してきてくれませんか
column4:
I think there's probably some kind of demon
hanging around.
Arisen, can you go kill that guy?

column3:
詳しくは追って説明しますんで
一度考えてみてください
このボルドの未来のためと思って、頼みます！
column4:
I'll follow up with more details.
Please think about it once
I'm asking you to do this for the future of this
Volden!

column3:
ところで覚者さん、《ボルド大坑道》の中にある
《灼熱の封鎖道》なんですが
ご興味があったりはしませんかね？
column4:
By the way, Arisen, I was wondering if you might
be interested in
"Burning Blockade" in the "Great Volden Tunnel"?

column3:
いえ、というのもですね！
ああいうところには良質な鉱脈が
埋まっていることが多いんですよ
column4:
No, I mean, you know!
There are often good veins of ore
buried in places like that!

column3:
特に私が目を付けているのは
この辺りだけで、それもごく少量しか採れない
貴重なボルディックダイヤってやつでしてね
column4:
I'm particularly interested in
which is only found around here, and only in very
small quantities.
It's called a precious bordic diamond.

column3: ――あるんじゃないか、と――！
column4: ――Maybe, or maybe not――!

column3:
あそこは地下のマグマの活性度によって
坑内の気温がやたら上がってしまうってことで
封鎖してたんですが
今なら何とか入れる状態なんですよ
column4:
The mine was closed
because the activity of the magma underground
causes
the temperature in the mine to rise dramatically,
but
it is now in a state where we can manage to get
in.

column3:
今回もこっそり封鎖を解いておきますんで
よかったら、一度中を調査してみてください！
絶対何かあると思うんですよね、あそこは――
column4:
I'll be sneaking off the blockade again this time.
If you'd like, you can investigate inside once
more!
I'm sure there's something in there that--

column3:
おや、ちょうどいいところに！
覚者さんにご相談したいことが
あったんですよ！
column4:
Oh, just in time!
There was something I wanted to discuss with the
Arisen
!

column3:
実は私も《灼熱の封鎖道》に入ってみたんですがね
ボルディックダイヤどころか
ジオゴーレムを見つけてしまいまして！
column4:
I actually went into the "Burning Blockade"
and found not only a bordic diamond, but
a geo-golem!

column3:
いやぁ、やっぱり封鎖されて長いと
ああいうのが棲みついてしまうんですねぇ
column4:
Well, after all, if it's been blockaded for a
long time,
that kind of thing will inhabit it.

column3:
なんとか討伐をお願いできないでしょうか？
詳しくはまた追ってご説明しますので！
column4:
Can you please manage to take them down?
I will explain the details as soon as possible!

column3:
いやぁ～～！！
覚者さんのご活躍には
我々ただもう舌を巻くばかり！
column4:
Oh no!
We at
just can't get enough of your work!

column3:
このキノザ鉱泉の管理者として、
そしてボルドのエリアマスターとして
ここはお礼を奮発しないとですな！
column4:
As the manager of Kinoza Mineral Springs,
and as an Area Master of Voldic,
we need to spare no expense to show our gratitude
here!

column3:
良いものを取り揃えておきますんで
今後とも、どうぞよしなに！
column4:
We will prepare good things for you
so please continue to favor us in the future!

column3:
いやぁ、温泉は最高だよ！
まさに命の湯、生き返るね！
column4:
Oh, hot springs are the best!
It's truly the water of life, it revitalizes you!

column3:
キノザに来たら、一回はほら
行きたいだろ！？　《豊穣の泉》！！
しかしアレだよ、料金がなぁ
column4:
When you come to Kinoza, you know you want to go
to
at least once! You want to go to the Fountain of
Abundance at least once when you come to Kinoza!
But that's the thing, the price.

column3:
ふー、湯の後は酒場で一杯！
お陰でここを離れられないよ
column4:
Whew, after the hot water, I had a drink at the
bar!
Thanks to you, I'll never leave this place!

column3: やあ、何かな？
column4: Hello, do you need something?

column3:
覚者がわざわざボルド地方まで任務か
まぁ、大かた温泉目当てだろう？
column4:
So, the Arisen went all the way to the Volden
region on a mission.
Well, they went for the hot springs, didn't they?

column3:
キノザは鉱石と武具の町でもある
白竜神殿や、我ら白騎団
それに覚者にとっても重要な拠点だ
column4:
Kinoza is not only a town of minerals and
armaments, but also serves as a significant base
for the White Dragon Temple, our White Knights,
and is of importance to the Arisen ones as well.

column3:
だからその、なんだ
お前ら覚者が見張りになってもいいと
思うんだがな
column4:
So, you know, what the hell.
I'm sure you Arisen folks could be on the
lookout for

column3:
ハインツ副団長にあったらよろしく伝えてくれ
あと、そろそろ配置変えはどうか、とな
column4:
Please give my regards to Vice Commander Heinz
and also, how about changing the formation soon?

column3: うん？　覚者か
column4: Hmm? An Arisen?

column3: ほら、向こうの山頂に祠が見えるでしょ？
column4:
Look, can you see the shrine at the summit over
there?

column3:
あの《山頂の小堂》は
以前は白竜様と、故人への祈りの場として
大事にされる場所だったそうです
column4:
That "small hall at the top of the mountain"
used to be a place of prayer for the White Dragon
and the deceased

column3:
今はちょくちょく魔物が出る上
でっかい鷲がすぐ傍に巣を作ったとかで
寄りつく人が居なくなったとか
column4:
Nowadays, there are always demons and
a big eagle has built a nest right next to it, so
there's no one left to hang around.

column3: どこも大変ですよねえ
column4: Everywhere is tough, isn't it?

column3:
キノザは人も多いし品も豊富です
商売するにはいい土地なんですが
商売仇が多いのが玉に傷ですねえ
column4:
Kinoza has a lot of people and a lot of goods.
It's a good place to do business.
It's just that there are a lot of business people.

column3:
あたしにとっては、準備と勉強の場って
とこでしょうか
column4: For me, the place to prepare and study is at

column3:
あたしゃ、近々素材を扱う行商を
始めようと思ってるんですよ
column4:
I'm thinking of starting a materials peddling
business
in the near future!

column3:
近くに素材を取りにいくにも
なかなかどうして魔物が厄介なんですよ
column4:
It's not easy to gather materials nearby
because of those troublesome monsters.

column3: いい坑道はあちこちにあるんですけどねえ
column4: There are good mines everywhere, but...

column3:
どうも覚者さん
あたしにご用で？
column4:
Hi, Arisen.
You wanted to see me?

column3:
ふー、遠出したいけど勇気がでなくて――
強い護衛を雇うしかないかなぁ
column4:
Whew, I want to go away, but I'm not brave
enough--
I guess I'll just have to hire a strong escort.

column3:
ゴツゴツした岩みたいな鬼やらトカゲやら
外にはうようよ居るっていうじゃないか
あわわわ
column4:
There are rough-looking demons or lizards or
something like that,
and they say that there are a lot of them outside.
Ahh...

column3:
よ、よしリンウッドまで行くぞ！
そ、そのうちに――
column4:
Alright, let's go to Lynwood!
And, eventually--

column3: や、やぁ、何か用？
column4: Um, um, do you need something?

column3:
そ、そういえばさ
キノザからちょっと山の麓へ下りて
北に行ったところに《ボルド小坑道》って
場所があるのは知ってるかい？
column4:
Oh, by the way,
did you know that there is a place called "Volden
Narrow Tunnels"
north of Kinoza, a little down the foot of the
mountain?

column3:
そこはかなり前から怖いオーガがうろつく
ようになったんたけど、派遣された騎士団が
かなりやられちゃったらしいんだ！
column4:
There has been a scary ogre roaming
around there for quite a while now, but the
knights who were sent there
got hit pretty hard, I heard!

column3:
戦いの跡がまだ残ってて、《山腹の野戦場》
なんて呼ばれているよ
ううう、おそろしい――！
column4:
There are still battle scars and it's called
《Fieldsides of the Mountainside》
Ugh, horrifying--!

column3:
ふう、貴重な宝石の原石を探しに
ここへ来たのだけれど、魔物が邪魔で
なかなか思うように探せないわ
column4:
I came here
to look for precious gemstones, but the demons
are in the way
and I can't find them as easily as I'd like.

column3:
ねぇあなた、《ボルド大坑道》へは行った？
閉鎖されてから、中はどうなっているのかしら
column4:
Hey, have you been to the Volden Tunnel?
I wonder what's going on in there since it was
closed.

column3:
巨人出現って、サイクロプスかコロッサス
でも出たのかしら
column4:
Giants appeared, were there also Cyclops or
Colossus
?

column3:
魔物の中には、宝石を身体に生やした
ステキな生き物もいるそうなの
column4:
It seems that among the enemies there are also
creatures with gems growing on their bodies like

column3:
まるで宝石そのもの、みたいな魔物も
いるらしいわ
column4:
They say there are monsters that look just like
real gems.

column3: なんとか生け捕りにできないかしら
column4: I wonder if they can be captured alive somehow

column3: その様子、あなたも探索者かしら？
column4: Are you also an adventurer exploring this place?

column3:
ここは《癒しの泉》です
ゆっくり旅のお疲れを癒してくださいね
column4:
This is the "Spring of Healing"
Please relax and heal your fatigue from your
journey

column3:
浴場では、ミックスハーブの蒸気も
炊いているんですよ
column4:
In the bath, we are also steaming
mixed herbs

column3: ごゆっくり
column4: Enjoy your stay

column3: 《癒しの泉》のお湯はいかがですか？
column4:
How about the hot spring water at the "Spring of
Healing"?

column3:
ふー、いいお湯！
のぼせないようにしないとねぇ
column4:
Whew, nice hot water!
I'll have to try not to get bloated!

column3:
あんた、異国の覚者なんだろ！？
あのタラスクの討伐してきてくれないかい？
column4:
Are you an Arisen from a foreign land?!
Would you be willing to vanquish the Tarasque for
us?

column3:
引き受けてくれるなら
タラスクの居場所を知ってる子に話を通すから
あたしに話しかけておくれ
column4:
If you're willing to take on the task, I'll have
a conversation with the child who knows the
whereabouts of the Tarasque.
Please speak to me.

column3:
ああ、よく来たね！
あんたがタラスクを退治してくれたおかげで
地鳴りも聞こえなくなったよ！
column4:
Ah, you've come! Thanks to you for defeating the
Tarasque, we can no longer hear the rumbling of
the land!

column3:
最近色んなことが起こるから
うちの戦士たちも疲れててさ――
あんたに助けてもらえて、本当に感謝してるよ
column4:
Lately, so many things have been happening, and
my soldiers are tired... I really appreciate your
help.

column3:
武勇の恩には報いるのが
このダナのならわしだよ！
支援品を格上げしておいたから
またいつでもダナに顔見せにきとくれ！
column4:
It is our custom to repay the debt of bravery.
I have upgraded the support goods for you.
So please feel free to come and show your face in
Dana anytime!

column3:
また困ったことが起きたよ――
こんなに問題が起きるなんて
一体フィンダムはどうしちまったのかね
column4:
Another problem has occurred -
I never thought so many issues would arise.
What on earth happened to Phindym?

column3:
実は、また地鳴りがするようになったんだ
あんたにタラスクを退治してもらったはずなのに
おかしいだろ？
column4:
Actually, the ground is shaking again.
We asked you to defeat the Tarasque, didn't we?
Something's not right.

column3:
あの地鳴り――タラスクのものじゃなかったのかねぇ
もうあたしらには見当もつかないよ
column4:
That shaking ground... it wasn't caused by the
Tarasque, was it?
We have no idea anymore.

column3:
――このファーラナ平原のはずれ
《<SPOT 904>》に、異文化を持った村があるんだ
そこの住人なら何かを知っているかも――
column4:
At the outskirts of the Farana Plain, there's a
village known as <SPOT 904>, inhabited by people
of a different culture.
Those villagers might know something...

column3:
でも、あそこの住人、どうもダナの人間が
嫌いみたいで交流が難しいんだよねぇ――
column4:
But it seems like the people living there really
don't like the residents of Dana, so it's
difficult to interact with them.

column3:
ねぇ、もしよかったらあんたが探りを
入れてきてくれないかい？
通りかかったらでいいからさ
column4:
Hey, if you don't mind, could you do some probing
for me?
If you happen to pass by, that would be great.

column3:
ああ――そういえば、あんた
《マヌンの集落》に顔出してくれたんだろ？
column4:
Ah, by the way, didn't you show up in Manun
Village?

column3:
あそこの長老のエナン――とか
いう人から手紙が届いたんだ
column4:
I received a letter from the elder of that place,
Enan.

column3:
なんでも
「信頼に値する相手だと証明してくれ」
「そのために《<SPOT 901>》
　の魔物を倒してくれ」ってことらしいよ
column4:
It seems they want you to 'prove yourself as a
trustworthy ally.'
You can do that by 'defeating the monsters in
<SPOT 901>,' according to the villagers.

column3:
要するに、武勇を見せろってことさ――
マヌンの住人たちって、もしかしたら
あたしらと似た文化を持ってるのかもね
column4:
In short, they're telling us to show our bravery,
you know? The residents of Manun might actually
have a similar culture to ours.

column3:
まぁ、とにかくそういうことなんだ
彼らに"信頼に値する相手"だって証明するため
魔物退治に行ってくれる気になったら
また声かけておくれよ
column4:
Well, anyway, that's how it is.
In order to prove that we are "trustworthy
allies" to them, if you ever feel like going on a
monster extermination, please let us know again.

column3:
そうそう、あんたが
《マヌンの集落》のエナン爺さんに
聞いてきてくれた《知恵の小塔》なんだけどさ
column4:
Oh, that's right. You brought me info about the
Small Tower of Wisdom that you asked Enan from
Manun Village about, didn't you?

column3:
なんでも、あそこに収められた昔の本に
今度こそ手がかりがあるかもっていうから
封鎖を解くことにしたんだ
column4:
Because there might be a clue in the old books
stored there, we decided to lift the blockade this
time.

column3:
今、手の空いてる子たちに
本を漁らせてるところさ
column4:
Now, I'm letting the children who have free hands
search for books.

column3:
古臭い本以外にも色々ありそうだから
あんたも入りたかったら入っていいよ
何か見つけたら、好きに持って帰りな
column4:
Besides old-fashioned books, there seem to be
various other things here.
If you want to join, you're welcome to.
If you find something you like, feel free to take
it home.

column3:
まぁ、わかってるとは思うけど
本の持ち出しは禁止させてもらうけどね
column4:
Well, I think you understand, but I have to
prohibit taking books out.

column3:
ああ！
何だってあんたはいつも
村が危ないって時に来てくれるんだろうね？
column4:
Ah!
Why is it that you always come when the village
is in danger, I wonder?

column3:
実は今、大変なのさ
タラスクみたいな巨大な動くものを
見たって報告があってね――
column4:
Actually, right now things are tough.
There have been reports of a gigantic moving
creature, like a Tarasque.

column3:
最悪、すぐにでも村ごと別の場所へ
移動しなけりゃ踏み潰されちまうかもしれない
そうなったら、あんたにも
手を貸してもらうかも――
column4:
At worst, we may need to move the entire village
to a different location immediately, or else we
might be crushed.
If that happens, I may ask for your help as
well...

column3:
とにかく今は情報を集めることで
手一杯なんだ
何か用があるなら、改めて話しかけてもらえるかい
column4:
Right now, I'm really busy gathering information.
If you have something to discuss, could you
please talk to me again later?

column3:
あんたのお陰で地鳴りも止んで
平和な生活が戻ってきたよ
ずいぶん世話になったね！
column4:
Thanks to you, even the earthquakes have stopped,
and peace has returned to our lives.
We are truly grateful for all your help!

column3:
まだまだ侵食魔はウロウロしちゃいるけど
ダナは戦士の村だ
そこら辺にいる侵食魔くらい、痛くもかゆくもないさ
column4:
The corrupting monsters are still lurking around,
but Dana is a warrior's village.
The infected around here are nothing to be
worried about.

column3:
侵食と地鳴り――
二つの厄介ごとを抱えてたこの村に
手を貸してくれてありがとう
column4:
Corruption and Earthquakes -
Thank you for lending a hand to this village
burdened with two troubles.

column3:
これほど力を貸してもらったんだ
エリアマスターとして
それからダナの族長ピサルの女房として
あんたには十分なお礼をしなきゃならない
column4:
I've received so much help.
As an Area Master, and also as the wife of
Pisarr, the chief of Dana, I must express my
gratitude to you properly.

column3:
とりあえず、あんたへの支給品に
より一層良いものを揃えるってことは
決まってるんだけど――
column4:
For now, it has been decided to gather even
better supplies for you, but...

column3:
それ以外に、どんなお礼をしようか
迷ってるところなんだよ
何せ、この恩を返せるようなお礼なんて
中々思い浮かばないもんだからさ！
column4:
Apart from that, I'm at a loss as to what kind of
gratitude I should express.
After all, it's not easy to come up with a way to
repay this favor!

column3:
まぁ、これからもダナには寄るんだろ？
勇敢な戦士として、いつでも迎えるからさ
お礼についても追々考えていくことにしようか――
column4:
Well, I guess I'll continue relying on Dana from
now on, right?
As a brave soldier, I'll always be there to
welcome you.
Let's think about the expression of gratitude
little by little as well.

column3:
あんた、覚者ってなら竜のために戦うんだろ？
エモノは一体何なんだい？
大剣？　それとも弓？
column4:
Hey, if you're an Arisen, then you fight for the
dragons, right?
So what exactly are those?
Are they like greatswords or bows?

column3:
もしもあんたがそこそこ槍を使えるようなら――
いつか、精霊槍の達人に紹介してやってもいいよ
レスタニアには精霊槍を扱う戦士は
いなさそうだからね
column4:
If you're reasonably skilled with a spear, then
someday I could introduce you to a master of the
Spirit Lance.
There don't seem to be any soldiers in Lestania
who handle Spirit Lances, you see.

column3:
戦士に休息の場を提供するのがわしの仕事だ
宿の手配から弱化回復まで、何でも言ってくれ
column4:
It is my job to provide a place of rest for
warriors.
From arranging accommodations to weakening
recovery, tell me anything you need.

column3:
勇猛な戦士にも休息は必要だ
必要な時に必要なだけ休まねばならん
column4:
Even a brave warrior needs rest.
You must rest as much as necessary, when
necessary.

column3:
寝床を使うなら<VAL PRICE_INN>貰うことになるが
いいか？
column4:
If you use the bed, you will have to pay <VAL PRICE_INN>
 gold, but are you okay with that?

column3: はい
column4: OK

column3: いいえ
column4: Cancel

column3:
見ての通り、今は空いている
よし、好きな寝床を使うといい！
column4:
As you can see, it is currently vacant.
Alright, you should use whichever sleeping spot
you like!

column3: はい
column4: OK

column3: いいえ
column4: Cancel

column3:
戦って、一時の休息を楽しむ――
そしてまた戦いに出る！
どうだ、これこそ戦士として理想の生活だろう
column4:
Fight, and enjoy a momentary rest--
And then, go forth to battle again!
How is it? This is surely the ideal life as a
Soldier, isn't it?

column3:
《弱化の治療》なら
<VAL PRICE_WEAK>必要だが――
column4:
If it's "Treat Weakness", it's <VAL PRICE_WEAK>.
What do you want to do?

column3: はい
column4: OK

column3: いいえ
column4: Cancel

column3:
ハッハッハ！
弱化にはなっていないようだ
弱気にはなっているようだがな
column4:
Hahaha!
You don't seem to have weakened.
You seem to have become more timid, though.

column3:
わしも今は引退してのんびりしているが
鍛練は怠っていないぞ
column4:
I am also currently retired and enjoying a
leisurely life, but I have not neglected my
training.

column3:
――まずは身の証を立ててから
来るべきじゃないのか？
column4:
First, shouldn't we establish our credibility
before we come?

column3:
身の証を立てる前に
休息を取りたいというなら
そりゃ、かまわんが――
column4:
Before proving your innocence, if you wish to
take some rest,
Well then, it's fine...

column3:
ハーイ、色々揃えてるわよ
どうぞ見て行ってね
column4:
Yes, I have various things.
Please feel free to take a look!

column3:
ピサルとラザネイル、素敵でしょ？
ああいう夫婦が理想なのよね
column4:
Pisarr and Razanailt, aren't they wonderful?
That's the ideal kind of couple.

column3:
たくさん覚者がいたら
一人一人が受けられる竜力が少なくならない？
何人もの覚者より、強い覚者が一人いた方が
安心できると思うんだけど
column4:
If there were many Arisen, wouldn't the Dragon
Force that each one can receive be diminished?
I think it would be more reassuring to have one
strong Arisen than a number of Arisen.

column3: あれ？　何も買っていかないの？
column4: Huh? You're not buying anything?

column3:
あ――もしかして、騒ぎになってた
異国の覚者さん？
column4:
Oh, are you the Arisen from the foreign land that
caused all the commotion?

column3:
――まずは身の証を立ててから
買い物しに来てくれるとうれしいわ
ちょっと信用できないもの
column4:
--First, I would be happy if you could prove your
identity before shopping. I can't trust you that
easily.

column3:
や、やぁ――
クレストのことかな？
column4: Ah, um... Is it about Crests?

column3:
クレストっていうのは、装備に付けられる
特殊な力の結晶らしいよ
僕は管理を任されてるだけなんだけど――
column4:
Crests are apparently crystals that can be
attached to equipment, possessing special powers.
I'm just in charge of managing them...

column3:
僕は子供の頃から線が細くて
戦いでも狩りでも中々手柄を上げられなくて――
column4:
Since I was a child, I have always been frail,
unable to achieve any remarkable feats in battles
or hunts...

column3:
なんて、よそから来た人には
この気持ち、わからないよな
column4:
Oh, someone who comes from elsewhere would never
understand this feeling.

column3:
戦いよりもこういうことの方が向いてるだろうって
ピサルからこの仕事を任されたんだ
自分でもそう思うよ
column4:
I was entrusted with this job by Pisarr, who
believed that I was more suited for something like
this than for battle.
I think so too.

column3:
――だけど、イーヴィの好みは
"誰よりも強い男"なんだよなぁ
column4:
But Evey's preference is for a 'man stronger than
anyone else,' you know.

column3:
あの――
身の証を立ててから来てもらえないかな
こういうのって信用が大事だからさ
column4:
You know, it would be great if you could come
after proving yourself.
Because trust is important in situations like
this.

column3:
戦いに行くの？
パーティの編成なら私がお手伝いするわ！
column4:
Are you going to the battle?
If you need help with party formation, I can
assist you!

column3:
力強く、信頼できる仲間と集まることで
一人ひとりの戦士の働きもよくなるはずよ！
column4:
By gathering together strong and reliable
comrades, the efforts of each individual soldier
should also improve!

column3:
ポーンを呼ぶこともできるけど――
どうする？
column4:
You can also call for Pawns.
What will you do?

column3:
変わった衣装――
それがあなたたちの力を引き出す衣なのね
ううん、見慣れないだけで――素敵よ
column4:
Unusual costumes...
Those clothes bring out your power, don't they?
No, it's just because they're unfamiliar...
They're wonderful.

column3:
あっ――
えっと、異国の方――
身の証を立ててもいない怪しい人と喋ってたら
族長に怒られちゃうから――
column4:
Ah—
Um, traveler from a foreign land—
Talking to a suspicious person like me, who
hasn't even proven their identity might anger the
clan chief—

column3: ――何だ
column4: ...What is it?

column3:
この村を纏めているのは
壮健で誇り高き族長、ピサルだ
column4:
The one who leads this village is the robust and
proud chieftain, Pisarr.

column3: 異国の覚者、か――
column4: The Arisen from a foreign land, eh――

column3:
ほう、なるほど
中々鋭い目をしている
column4: Oh, I see. You have quite sharp eyes.

column3: まずは身の証を立てるんだな
column4: First, prove yourself.

column3: おっ、何か用かよ？
column4: Oh, do you need something?

column3:
武器の手入れはいつでも万全だ！
早いとこ戦いに出て手柄を立てたいぜ
column4:
I always ensure that my weapons are in perfect
condition!
I can't wait to go into battle and earn some
credit!

column3:
俺だってダナの戦士
狩りでもいい働きをしているはずだ！
column4:
I, too, am a soldier of Dana.
I should be able to contribute to the hunt!

column3:
族長が狩りに行く時にでも
同行させてもらえりゃ早いんだけどな――
中々アピールするタイミングが――
column4:
If I could just accompany the chief when they go
hunting, we could expedite things, you know――
It's just difficult to find the right timing to
make my appeal――

column3:
盾も剣も、毎日点検しては磨いてるんだぜ
もちろん鍛錬も欠かさねぇ！
column4:
I inspect and polish my shield and sword every
day, and of course, I never neglect my training!

column3:
てめぇ、まずは身の証を立ててからにしろよな
この村で怪しげなことしたら承知しねぇぞ
column4:
First, prove yourself before you speak.
I won't tolerate any suspicious activities in
this village.

column3: 私に用か？
column4: You wanted to see me?

column3:
村に外敵が侵入しないように
ここで見張っているのだ
column4:
I'm here to watch over this place and to ensure
no enemies invade the village.

column3:
ダナはフィンダムでも知られた勇猛な部族の村だが
子供や年寄り、戦いの苦手な者もいる
彼らを守ってこその部族だ
column4:
Dana is a village known all over Phindym for its
brave and fierce tribe, but it also has children,
elders, and those who are not skilled in combat.
Protecting them is what makes our tribe strong.

column3:
ずっと見張りをしていて疲れないのか、だと？
この程度どうということはない
column4:
Do you mean that you never get tired from keeping
watch? It's nothing to be concerned about.

column3:
私に構ってないで村に入ったらどうだ
大方、ピサルかラザネイルに会いに来たのだろう？
column4:
Why don't you enter the village instead of
ignoring me?
Most likely, you've come to meet Pisarr or
Razanailt, haven't you?

column3: すまないが、まずは身の証を立てるのが先だろう
column4:
I'm sorry, but first you should prove your
identity.

column3: はいはい、何の御用？
column4: Yes, yes. What can I help you with?

column3:
うちも育ち盛りの子が多いからね
山のように用意した食事が
あっという間に無くなるのは見てて気分いいもんさ
column4:
We also have many children who are in their
growing years, you know.
It's satisfying to see the meals we prepared like
a mountain disappear in no time.

column3:
アンタも覚者だったら戦いに出ること、あるんだろ？
この村でしっかり食べて、体を休めて
次の旅立ちに備えるんだよ
column4:
If you are also an Arisen, there must be
something you fight for, right?
Eat well and rest your body in this village, and
prepare yourself for the next journey.

column3:
ふぅ、洗濯物は済んだし
次は家畜の世話でもしに行こうかな
column4:
Phew, the laundry is done.
Now, should I go take care of the livestock?

column3:
あっ――
あんた、さっき表で騒いでた奴らの仲間だね？
column4:
Ah... Are you one of the people who were causing
a ruckus outside earlier?

column3:
本当に覚者だっていうんなら
さっさと身の証を立ててきちまいなよ
そしたらややこしいことも無くなるんだからさ
column4:
If you really claim to be an Arisen, then quickly
prove yourself and settle it.
That way, there won't be any more complications.

column3:
《武霊の庵》のそばにある物見台はサイコーなんだ！
フィンダム全体が見渡せるし
"芯なる樹"がすっごくキレイに見えるよ
column4:
The observation deck next to the Spirit Arts Hut
is awesome!
You can oversee the entire Phindym, and the Core
Tree looks incredibly beautiful.

column3: 何だよ？　ここはオレの場所だかんな！
column4: What's going on? This is my spot, you know!

column3:
ここからは村の中くらいなら見渡せるよ
でも、やっぱり村の外を眺めたいなぁ――
column4:
From here, you can see around the middle of the
village.
But, I still want to gaze at the outside of the
village...

column3:
村の入り口はワイニが守ってる
万が一魔物が村に入ってきたって
ダナは戦士の村だからへっちゃらだ！
column4:
The village entrance is guarded by Wine.
Even if monsters somehow get into the village,
it's no big deal because Dana is a warrior's
village!

column3:
一人前の戦士になったら
ワイニみたいに武器を持って村を守りたいんだ
column4:
Once I become a skilled warrior, I want to
protect the village like Wine does, wielding a
weapon.

column3: ――怪しい人とはあんまり喋っちゃダメなんだ
column4:
- You shouldn't talk too much with suspicious
people.

column3: なによ
column4: What is it?

column3:
これからは腕力だけじゃやってけないわ
知識よ、あらゆる状況に対応できる知識が必要なの！
みんなわかってないの！
column4:
From now on, it won't be enough to rely on arm
strength alone.
Knowledge, I need knowledge that can adapt to any
situation!
Everyone just doesn't understand!

column3:
属性がどうとか弱点がなんだとか
そういう知識だけじゃなくて！
もっと幅広い知識を身に付けたいの――
戦いの役に立つはずよ
column4:
It's not just about knowing attributes and
weaknesses.
I want to acquire a broader range of knowledge.
It should be useful in battle.

column3:
暇なの？
ボーッとしてないで、知識を蓄えるなり
身体を鍛えるなりした方がいいんじゃない？
column4:
Are you free?
Instead of spacing out, it would be better to
accumulate knowledge or train your body, wouldn't
it?

column3:
なんなの、怪しい人ね！
信用してほしいんなら、さっさと身の証を
立ててこればいいじゃない！
column4:
What's the matter? You're such a suspicious
person!
If you want me to trust you, then quickly provide
some proof and establish it!

column3: どうした？
column4: Hm, what is it?

column3:
何か面白い話は無いか、だと？
昔話でもすると思ったか
ヌムム――年寄り扱いしおって
column4:
Do you want to hear an interesting story or
something?
Did you think I was going to tell you an old
tale?
Gah, treating me like an old man.

column3:
昔話を聞いて喜ぶ暇があれば
将来のために何ができるかを考えるんだな
column4:
If you have time to rejoice in listening to old
tales, then ponder what you can do for the future.

column3:
ダナの村は戦士の村だ
強くあるからこそ、護るべきものを
支えることができるのだ
column4:
Dana's village is a village of Soldiers.
It is because they are strong that they can
protect what needs to be protected and support it.

column3:
確かに――
俺も、そこのオドランも
すでに戦士としての役からは降りておる――
column4:
Indeed, I and Odran over there have already
retired from our roles as soldiers.

column3:
だが！
だからといって日々の研鑽を怠ることはない
若者に道を譲っただけのこと
column4:
However! I will never neglect my daily training
and pursuit of knowledge.
It's just a matter of giving way to the younger
generation.

column3:
お前は今、別のミッションを進行している
ようだな――
column4:
It seems that you are currently engaged in
another Mission, Ser.

column3:
そのミッションの参加を取りやめてから
あらためてここに来るんだな
column4:
After canceling your participation in that
mission, you have come here again.

column3:
自分の今の状況を把握することは
戦う者にとって常に重要なことだ
column4:
Understanding one's current situation is always
important for a warrior.

column3:
覚者だと言う割に
身の証も立てられんのか？
そんなことでは信用できんな
column4:
Even though you claim to be an Arisen, can you
not provide any proof of your abilities?
I can't trust someone who can't even do that.

column3:
アンタ――他のミッションを
受けている最中じゃないか
column4:
Are you――in the middle of receiving another
mission?

column3:
そちらを先に片づけるか、エントリーを
中止してからまた来るんだね
column4:
Shall we tidy up that area first, or should we
cancel the entry and come back later?

column3: さ、用件は何？
column4: So, what's the subject?

column3:
――ふぅん
なかなか鍛えてるね
column4: Oh, I see. You're quite well trained.

column3:
大物を狩りに行くなら
レウェラに声をかけて
仲間を集めた方がいいよ
column4:
If you're going to hunt a big game, it's better
to ask Revela for help and gather your comrades.

column3:
覚者が何人も居るってことは
ポーンもいっぱいいるんだろうね
アンタのところの大陸には
column4:
There must be many Arisen, which means there are
probably plenty of Pawns too in your continent.

column3:
いざという時の戦力に
余裕がありそうで羨ましいよ
column4:
It's enviable to have such a surplus of strength
when the time comes.

column3: 身の証を立ててから出直してくるんだね
column4: Come back after proving your worth.
